III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A during an altercation that occurred on
07/07/2025.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 07/22/2025 and had no
further information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/21/2025 during an announced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. She recalled the incident in
question beginning with her walking outside of the facility buildings
and Staff 1 following her. She recalled picking up some sort of
large pole and walking with it. Youth A intended to put the pole
down but felt that Staff 1 was too verbally aggressive in asking her
to do so. Youth A believed he grabbed the pole from behind her
and took it from her. Youth A recalled getting upset at this. She
climbed on top of a chair that was sitting near a brick wall, and
Youth A felt Staff 1 tried to pull her down from the chair, causing
her to fall. Youth A did not recall if she fell to the ground or landed
on her feet when coming off of the chair. Youth A believed that
was when she saw a rock on the ground and attempted to pick it
up only for Staff 1 to stomp on her hand. She recalled Staff 1
stating that he was going to go get other staff in order to “put her
down.” As he stepped away from Youth A, she threw the rock and
it hit him. Youth A denied aiming at Staff 1. She was unsure what
immediately happened to Staff 1 when he was hit by the
rock. Youth A believed Staff 1 made reference to wanting other
youth to come outside and fight Youth A at this point. Youth A
recalled Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 coming outside at this
point. She believed Staff 1 was taken to the hospital. Youth A
confirmed law enforcement came to the facility a short time later
and she was taken into custody because of the assault. She also
recalled attempting to punch Staff 1 but did not know when that
occurred during the incident. Youth A believed Staff 1 pushed her
2

as a result of her attempting to punch him. Youth A denied being
by the shed outside and did not recall anything about attempting
to take nails and self-harm herself. Youth A showed scratches on
her forearms at the time of the interview, but she was not sure
where they came from. Youth A confirmed there were no other
youth or staff outside during the majority of the incident outside.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/21/2025 during an announced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He recalled being the one-on-one
staff for Youth A on the date of the incident. Staff 1 recalled Youth
A being in a good mood but “doing her own thing” in the afternoon,
resulting in her walking out of the unit towards the back of the
facility. Staff 1 could not recall if Youth A was saying much at this
time. He specifically recalled Youth A walking past other youth
that were vocally struggling, and she seemed unaffected. He
followed her to provide continued line of sight supervision. As she
walked further outside, Youth A began to pick up items that she
was finding such as stones on the cement ground and signs that
were sitting near a maintenance area of the building. Youth A
picked up a street sign that was attached to a metal post and
began to swing it around. Staff 1 recalled attempting to take this
from her as he was concerned about her safety and his, and he
was able to do so without much resistance. Youth A was then
beginning to escalate verbally, stating “Fuck Whaley” and “I am
gonna kill myself.” At this time Youth A was walking past a
maintenance shed and began to attempt to pull loose nails out of
the exterior walls of the shed. Staff 1 recalled past incidents
where Youth A had self-harmed before so he felt the need to stay
close and attempt to prevent her from picking up anything she
could use for self-harm. She was able to do so despite Staff 1
attempting to prevent her, and she tried to scratch her forearms
with the nails. Staff 1 recalled Youth A dropping these as she
continued walking and proceeding to try to pick up rocks on the
ground. He believed she was trying to throw rocks at windows so
he was trying to place himself in between Youth A and
windows. Staff 1 recalled Youth A getting in front of him and
began a throwing motion to throw the rock at the windows, and he
was able to reach from behind Youth A and block the
throw. Youth A then attempted to punch Staff 1. As he backed
up, Staff 1 noticed Youth A reached for the rock on the
ground. Staff 1 recalled diving to pick up the rock, but she was
able to do so first. He did not believe he and Youth A had any
physical contact when this occurred. Staff 1 then got up and
backed away from Youth A. She then moved away from him, only
to turn around and throw the rock back at Staff 1. Staff 1 felt the
rock hit him in the head. He was not sure if he lost consciousness
3

or not when this occurred. Staff 1 recalled seeing Staff 2 and Staff
4 come outside to assist the situation. He did not believe he
interacted with Youth A after this occurred but recalled seeing her
interact with law enforcement a brief time later. At the time of the
interview Staff 1 was aware that Youth A was taken to detention
for a short time because of the incident and stated he did not wish
for charges to be issued on Youth A. Staff 1 was taken to the
hospital to treat the head injury caused by Youth A hitting him with
the rock. Staff 1 confirmed no other staff or youth were involved in
the situation until Staff 2 and Staff 4 came outside. He believed
other youth came outside and were attempting to fight Youth A at
this point in time. Staff 1 denied ever pushing or hitting Youth
A. He did not understand where the allegation of him pushing her
off of a chair originated. He recalled Youth A climbing up on top of
a larger electrical box that was located outside, but he believed
she had climbed down on her own as he was keeping line of sight
from outside of arm’s reach away. Staff 1 denied any other staff
having to hold him back from Youth A and believed that this was
misconstrued from when other staff were assisting him after he
had been hit in the head.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/12/2025 over the phone. She
recalled she looked outside and saw what was occurring. As she
came out she saw Youth A standing a distance away from Staff 1
and Staff 1 was on the ground. She believed Staff 1 was briefly
unconscious. Staff 2 recalled Youth A being upset, stating Staff 1
did not need to be following her. Staff 2 heard Youth A yelling for
some time afterwards but did not hear her refer to Staff 1 pushing
or harming her in any way.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 09/12/2025 over the phone. She was
told to come out to the situation as Staff 1 had been hit with a rock
by Youth A. When Staff 3 came outside Youth A was hiding in an
exterior corner and was crying, stating that she did not mean to hit
Staff 1 with the rock. Other youth had come outside, and the
situation was somewhat chaotic. Staff 3 recalled Youth A being
taken away by law enforcement a short time later, and Staff 1
being taken to the hospital around the same time. Staff 3 never
heard Youth A refer to Staff 1 harming her in any way.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 09/17/2025 over the phone. She
recalled seeing the end of the incident unfold. Staff 4 stated she
saw Staff 1 be hit in the head by the rock thrown by Youth A as
she went outside. Staff 4 approached Youth A initially but then
turned her attention back to Staff 1 to assist him. She recalled
Staff 1 being in significant pain. As she did this Staff 4 recalled
4

seeing Youth A sitting on top of a short brick divider wall
outside. Youth A commented that she did not know that she had
hit Staff 1 with the rock and had not intended to do so. Staff 4
recalled asking Youth A to get down from the wall and Youth A
refused. Staff 4 believed she got down on her own. Staff 4
recalled seeing law enforcement arrive quickly and Youth A was
taken into custody for the assault. Staff 4 remembered Youth A
being very upset at that time and hearing her state that she was
sorry for what had occurred.
Facility Tour:
• The facility was toured during an announced, face-to-face
visit on 08/21/2025. The area where the incident occurred
was viewed. The maintenance shed viewed in the video
had some small nails on the back wall. There were no
large poles or signs located near areas described in
interviews or footage. Small rocks and stones were
scattered around the unfinished driveway portion of the
area as well as the open grassy area captured in the video
footage.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 07/07/2025 at 07:51pm was
provided and reviewed. This camera angle was located
outside of one of the units of the facility and pointed to an
open grassy area that was bordered on two sides by the
building and one side by dumpsters and a maintenance
shed. Youth A was seen walking around the back side of
the shed with Staff 1 trailing behind her. As she reached
towards the exterior wall of the shed Staff 1 attempted to
place his arms in between and Youth A slapped at
him. Staff 1 did not physically react and stood with his
arms crossed. Youth A then attempted to pick up a long
wooden board from the ground and Staff 1 attempted to
stop her from doing so by also reaching for the item. Youth
A then continued to move away from Staff 1 and Staff 1
trailed her. Youth A picked up an unidentified item from the
ground and swung her right arm at Staff 1. She then
attempted to pick up an item again, and Staff 1 attempted
to stop her by reaching for the same item. Youth A fell to
the ground on her left side as this was occurring, with Staff
1 standing above her and continuing to attempt to grab the
item. Staff 1 stepped away from Youth A and she stood up,
moving away from Staff 1. Youth A then threw an item at
Staff 1, and Staff 1 attempted to avoid being hit. It
appeared that the item hit Staff 1 in the side of his head as
5

he held his right hand to that side of his head. Youth A
backed away from Staff 1 as Staff 1 approached her. She
held up her right arm across her chest and Staff 1 grabbed
this arm and then released as he got closer. Youth A
moved closer to an exterior wall of the facility lined with tall
windows with Staff 1 continuing to follow her while holding
his right hand to the right side of his head. Youth A picked
up another item and Staff 1 attempted to retrieve this item
from Youth A by placing his left hand on her lower back and
grabbing at it with his right hand. Youth A walked in
between a large electrical box and dumpsters out of view
with Staff 1 following her. Youth A and Staff 1 could not be
seen at this point of the footage.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention Policy” was
provided and reviewed. This policy and procedure stated
that any hitting or striking of youth by staff is a prohibited
act.
• Separate facility Incident Report documentation forms were
provided and reviewed. This documentation, authored by
Staff 1 and Staff 3, provided detailed accounts of the
incident consistent with interviews provided for this
investigation.
• Personnel documentation for Staff 1 was provided and
reviewed:
o Staff 1 was last trained in the facility behavior
management and restraint model as of 07/10/2025.
o Discipline Notification forms for Staff 1’s employment
were reviewed. Two disciplinary actions had been
taken regarding missed required trainings, and one
for the improper use of the facility’s restraint model.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed Staff 1 did not push Youth
A or pull a chair from under Youth A during the incident.
Technical Assistance:
The facility is advised to instruct maintenance staff to limit and
remove any items from the exterior of the building or any out-
buildings that are not necessary and could be used by youth for
assaultive or self-harm behaviors, such as unnecessary nails and
posts.
6

Additionally, provide education to staff on assessing and providing
physical space between themselves and youth during escalated
situations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
